trans-unit.source: Represents the scrollbar of a chart axis.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisScrollBar> class is exposed as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.ScrollBar%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis> class.
Scrollbars allow the end user to scroll through data when a subset of data is being displayed.
A subset of data is referred to as a view, and is represented by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisScaleView> class.
Scrollbars are only shown when zooming occurs.
In other words, even if a scrollbar is enabled, it will only be visible when a view is being displayed.
To fix the position of scrollbars, the plotting area position of a chart area must not be set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition.Auto%2A>.
To explicitly set the plotting area position, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.InnerPlotPosition%2A> property.

To display scrollbars when a chart is first displayed, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisScaleView> class properties and methods so that a view is initially displayed to end users.
The background color, button color and width of scrollbars can be set using this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisScrollBar> class.

Note that there are two main types of scrolling: large scrolling, which occurs when the end user clicks in the background of a scrollbarâ€”that is, that part of a scrollbar not covered by the thumb; and small scrolling, which occurs when the end user clicks a left/right or up/down button.

To control the large scrolling size, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisScaleView.Size%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.ScaleView%2A> object.

To set the small scrolling size, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisScaleView.SmallScrollSize%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisScaleView> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisScrollBar"></xref> class.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis"></xref> object that uses the scrollbar.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the background color of a scrollbar.
This property can be set to any valid ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) color.

If the value of this property is <xref:System.Drawing.Color.Empty>, the background color of the scrollbar will be determined by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.BackColor%2A> property value of the chart area the scrollbar is being used for.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value that represents the background color of the scrollbar.
The default value is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Empty"></xref>.
Gets or sets the color of the scrollbar buttons.
Use this property to get or set the color of the left/right, up/down, reset and thumb buttons of a scrollbar.

If the value of this property is <xref:System.Drawing.Color.Empty>, the color used for the buttons will be determined by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.LineColor%2A> property value.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value that represents the color of the scrollbar buttons.
Gets or sets the style of the scrollbar button.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ScrollBarButtonStyles"></xref> enumeration value.
Gets the chart area that contains this scrollbar.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea"></xref> object.
Releases all resources used by the current instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisScrollBar"></xref>.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisScrollBar"></xref> class and optionally releases the managed resources.
`True` to release both unmanaged and managed resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets or sets a flag that determines whether a scrollbar is enabled.
`True` if the scrollbar is enabled for an axis, `false` if the scrollbar is not enabled.
The default value is `true`.
Gets or sets a flag that indicates whether scroll bar is positioned inside or outside the chart area.
`True` if the scroll bar is positioned inside or outside the chart area; otherwise, `False`.
Gets a flag that indicates whether the scrollbar is visible.
`True` if the scrollbar is visible; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the line color of a scrollbar.
This property represents the color used for the arrows in up/down and left/right buttons, the symbol inside the reset button, as well as the border of the entire scrollbar.

If the value of this property is <xref:System.Drawing.Color.Empty>, the line color used will be determined by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.LineColor%2A> property value.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value that represents the line color of the scrollbar.
The default value is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Empty"></xref>.
Gets or sets the width of a scrollbar, in pixels.
Gets or sets the width of a scrollbar, which can be from 5 to 20 pixels.
Set this property to zero to disable a scrollbar.
To fix the position of scrollbars, the plotting area position of a chart area must not be set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition.Auto%2A>.
To explicitly set the plotting area position, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.InnerPlotPosition%2A> property.
The width of a scrollbar in pixels.
The default value is 14 pixels.
The value can range from 5 to 20 pixels.
